meanings.definition: To divide into sections or categories
meanings.sent1: I like to compartmentalize my toys into different boxes.
meanings.sent2: She tends to compartmentalize her work tasks for better organization.
meanings.sent3: It's as if my brain tries to compartmentalize all the puzzle pieces.
meanings.sent4: He can compartmentalize his feelings like putting them in separate boxes.
meanings.sent5: Compartmentalizing my study materials helps me focus better.

meanings.definition: To separate or isolate different parts or aspects
meanings.sent1: The chef will compartmentalize the ingredients before cooking.
meanings.sent2: It's important to compartmentalize personal and professional life.
meanings.sent3: I tried to compartmentalize my socks, but they kept mixing up.
meanings.sent4: She could compartmentalize her worries, leaving only positivity.
meanings.sent5: Compartmentalizing tasks can make them more manageable.

meanings.definition: To mentally separate conflicting thoughts or emotions
meanings.sent1: He learned to compartmentalize his fear and focus on the task at hand.
meanings.sent2: She had to compartmentalize her sadness to stay strong for her family.
meanings.sent3: I tried to compartmentalize my excitement, but it bubbled over.
meanings.sent4: Compartmentalizing doubt can lead to a clearer decision-making process.
meanings.sent5: Compartmentalizing emotions can help maintain a sense of balance.
